alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 5:10AM EDT until June 27 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 10/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (5 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 9.2 Tue 4 am 3.4 MSG 9.2 6am 6/27 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 100 PM EDT.
